meanings.definition: A person or company that sells goods or services to consumers.
meanings.sent1: The tailers at the market had a wide variety of products for sale.
meanings.sent2: I always buy my clothes from the tailers in the mall.
meanings.sent3: The tailers decided to have a sale to attract more customers.
meanings.sent4: The tailers in the online store were like digital shopkeepers.
meanings.sent5: The tailers' shop was filled with colorful items that caught my eye.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that follows or trails behind.
meanings.sent1: The dog was the tailers of the group as they walked through the park.
meanings.sent2: The tailers of the parade waved to the crowd as they passed by.
meanings.sent3: The tailers of the race were determined to catch up to the leader.
meanings.sent4: The tailers of the team cheered on their teammates from behind.
meanings.sent5: The tailers in the line followed closely behind the leader.

meanings.definition: A person who is skilled in a particular activity or profession.
meanings.sent1: The chef was known as one of the best tailers in the culinary world.
meanings.sent2: She became a tailers in woodworking after years of practice.
meanings.sent3: The tailers of the art of painting created beautiful masterpieces.
meanings.sent4: He was a tailers in fixing cars, always knowing how to solve any problem.
meanings.sent5: The tailers of the craft fair showcased their handmade creations.
